intro: Dysphania minuata, commonly known as small leaf lambsquarters, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by triangular, beak-like seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Dysphania minuata is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds.
